info.title: Azure Load Testing
info.description: These APIs allow end users to create, view and run load tests using Azure Load Test Service.

get.summary: Get all test runs for the given filters.
get.description: Get all test runs for the given filters.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

get.summary: Get test run details by test run Id.
get.description: Get test run details by test run Id.

parameters.name: testRunId
parameters.description: Unique test run identifier for the load test run, must contain only lower-case alphabetic, numeric, underscore or hyphen characters.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

patch.summary: Create and start a new test run with the given test run Id.
patch.description: Create and start a new test run with the given test run Id.

parameters.name: testRunId
parameters.description: Unique test run identifier for the load test run, must contain only lower-case alphabetic, numeric, underscore or hyphen characters.

201.description: The request has succeeded and a new resource has been created as a result.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

delete.summary: Delete an existing load test run.
delete.description: Delete an existing load test run by providing the testRunId.

parameters.name: testRunId
parameters.description: Unique test run identifier for the load test run, must contain only lower-case alphabetic, numeric, underscore or hyphen characters.

204.description: There is no content to send for this request, but the headers may be useful.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

put.summary:
Upload input file for a given test Id. File size can't be more than 50 MB.
Existing file with same name for the given test will be overwritten. File
should be provided in the request body as application/octet-stream.
put.description:
Upload input file for a given test Id. File size can't be more than 50 MB.
Existing file with same name for the given test will be overwritten. File
should be provided in the request body as application/octet-stream.

parameters.name: testId
parameters.description:
Unique name for the load test, must contain only lower-case alphabetic,
numeric, underscore or hyphen characters.

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: Unique name for test file with file extension like : App.jmx

parameters.name: fileType
parameters.description: File type

201.description: The request has succeeded and a new resource has been created as a result.

Azure.Core.Foundations.ApiVersionParamet.name: api-version
Azure.Core.Foundations.ApiVersionParamet.description: The API version to use for this operation.

ListTestQueryParams.lastModifiedEndTime.name: lastModifiedEndTime
ListTestQueryParams.lastModifiedEndTime.description: End DateTime(RFC 3339 literal format) of the last updated time range to filter tests.

ListTestQueryParams.lastModifiedStartTim.name: lastModifiedStartTime
ListTestQueryParams.lastModifiedStartTim.description: Start DateTime(RFC 3339 literal format) of the last updated time range to filter tests.

ListTestQueryParams.orderby.name: orderby
ListTestQueryParams.orderby.description:
Sort on the supported fields in (field asc/desc) format. eg:
lastModifiedDateTime asc. Supported fields - lastModifiedDateTime

ListTestQueryParams.search.name: search
ListTestQueryParams.search.description:
Prefix based, case sensitive search on searchable fields - displayName,
createdBy. For example, to search for a test, with display name is Login Test,
the search parameter can be Login.

ListTestRunQueryParams.executionFrom.name: executionFrom
ListTestRunQueryParams.executionFrom.description: Start DateTime(RFC 3339 literal format) of test-run execution time filter range.

ListTestRunQueryParams.executionTo.name: executionTo
ListTestRunQueryParams.executionTo.description: End DateTime(RFC 3339 literal format) of test-run execution time filter range.

ListTestRunQueryParams.orderby.name: orderby
ListTestRunQueryParams.orderby.description:
Sort on the supported fields in (field asc/desc) format. eg: executedDateTime
asc. Supported fields - executedDateTime

ListTestRunQueryParams.search.name: search
ListTestRunQueryParams.search.description:
Prefix based, case sensitive search on searchable fields - description,
executedUser. For example, to search for a test run, with description 500 VUs,
the search parameter can be 500.

ListTestRunQueryParams.status.name: status
ListTestRunQueryParams.status.description: Comma separated list of test run status.

ListTestRunQueryParams.testId.name: testId
ListTestRunQueryParams.testId.description: Unique name of an existing load test.

MetricDimensionsRequest.interval.name: interval
MetricDimensionsRequest.interval.description: The interval (i.e. timegrain) of the query.

MetricDimensionsRequest.metricNamespace.name: metricNamespace
MetricDimensionsRequest.metricNamespace.description: Metric namespace to query metric definitions for.

MetricDimensionsRequest.timespan.name: timespan
MetricDimensionsRequest.timespan.description: The timespan of the query. It is a string with the following format 'startDateTime_ISO/endDateTime_ISO'.

OldTestRunIdQueryParam.name: oldTestRunId
OldTestRunIdQueryParam.description:
Existing test run identifier that should be rerun, if this is provided, the
test will run with the JMX file, configuration and app components from the
existing test run. You can override the configuration values for new test run
in the request body.

resourceName.description: Azure resource name, required while creating the app component.

resourceType.description: Azure resource type, required while creating the app component.

resourceGroup.description: Resource group name of the Azure resource

subscriptionId.description: Subscription Id of the Azure resource

AppComponent.description: An Azure resource object (Refer azure generic resource model :https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/resources/resources/get-by-id#genericresource)

resourceName.description: Azure resource name, required while creating the app component.

resourceType.description: Azure resource type, required while creating the app component.

AppComponentUpdate.description: An Azure resource object (Refer azure generic resource model :https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/resources/resources/get-by-id#genericresource)

url.description: This is a SAS URI to an Azure Storage Container that contains the test run artifacts.

expireDateTime.description: Expiry time of the container (RFC 3339 literal format)

autoStopDisabled.description: Whether auto-stop should be disabled. The default value is false.

errorRate.description: Threshold percentage of errors on which test run should be automatically stopped. Allowed values are in range of 0.0-100.0

errorRateTimeWindowInSeconds.description: Time window during which the error percentage should be evaluated in seconds.

AutoStopCriteria.description: Auto stop criteria for a test. This will automatically stop a load test if the error percentage is high for a certain time window.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

message.description: A human-readable representation of the error.

details.description: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

innererror.description: An object containing more specific information than the current object about the error.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

Azure.Core.Foundations.InnerError.description: An object containing more specific information about the error. As per Microsoft One API guidelines - https://github.com/Microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/vNext/Guidelines.md#7102-error-condition-responses.

value.description: The value of the certificate for respective type

values.description: The dimension values. Maximum values can be 20.

DimensionFilter.description: Dimension name and values to filter

nextLink.description: Link for the next set of values in case of paginated results, if applicable.

message.description: Error details in case test run was not successfully run.

ErrorDetails.description: Error details if there is any failure in load test run

expireDateTime.description: Expiry time of the file (RFC 3339 literal format)

engineInstances.description: The number of engine instances to execute load test. Supported values are in range of 1-400. Required for creating a new test.

splitAllCSVs.description:
If false, Azure Load Testing copies and processes your input files unmodified
across all test engine instances. If true, Azure Load Testing splits the CSV
input data evenly across all engine instances. If you provide multiple CSV
files, each file will be split evenly.

quickStartTest.description:
If true, optionalLoadTestConfig is required and JMX script for the load test is
not required to upload.

timeGrain.description:
The time grain specifies the aggregation interval for the metric. Expressed as
a duration 'PT1M', 'PT1H', etc.

MetricAvailability.description: Metric availability specifies the time grain (aggregation interval or frequency)

namespace.description: The namespace the metric belongs to.

primaryAggregationType.description: The primary aggregation type value defining how to use the values for display.

supportedAggregationTypes.description: The collection of what all aggregation types are supported.

metricAvailabilities.description:
Metric availability specifies the time grain (aggregation interval or
frequency).

value.description: the values for the metric definitions.

MetricNamespace.description: Metric namespace class specifies the metadata for a metric namespace.

value.description: The values for the metric namespaces.

filters.description:
Get metrics for specific dimension values. Example: Metric contains dimension
like SamplerName, Error. To retrieve all the time series data where SamplerName
is equals to HTTPRequest1 or HTTPRequest2, the DimensionFilter value will be
{"SamplerName", ["HTTPRequest1", "HTTPRequest2"}

MetricRequestPayload.description: Filters to fetch the set of metric.

timestamp.description: The timestamp for the metric value in RFC 3339 format.

value.description: The TimeSeriesElement items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

Metrics.description: The response to a metrics query.

defaultScopes.description: Oauth2 scopes of every flow. Overridden by scope definitions in specific flows

Oauth2.description: OAuth 2.0 Flow with Microsoft Entra ID.

endpointUrl.description: Test URL. Provide the complete HTTP URL. For example, https://contoso-app.azurewebsites.net/login

requestsPerSecond.description: Target throughput (requests per second). This may not be necessarily achieved. The actual throughput will be lower if the application is not capable of handling it.

maxResponseTimeInMs.description: Maximum response time in milliseconds of the API/endpoint.

PFAction.description: Action to take on failure of pass/fail criteria.

PFTestResult.description: Test result based on pass/fail criteria.

value.description: The Test items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

value.description: The TestFileInfo items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

value.description: The TestRun items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

passFailMetrics.description: Map of id and pass fail metrics { id  : pass fail metrics }.

PassFailCriteria.description: Pass fail criteria for a test.

clientMetric.description: The client metric on which the criteria should be applied.

aggregate.description:
The aggregation function to be applied on the client metric. Allowed functions
- percentage - for error metric , avg, p50, p90, p95, p99, min,
max - for response_time_ms and latency metric, avg - for requests_per_sec,
count - for requests

requestName.description: Request name for which the Pass fail criteria has to be applied

value.description:
The value to compare with the client metric. Allowed values - error : [0.0 ,
100.0] unit- % , response_time_ms and latency : any integer value unit- ms.

action.description: Action taken after the threshold is met. Default is continue.

name.description: The invariant value of metric name

ResourceMetric.description:
Associated metric definition for particular metrics of the azure resource (
Refer :
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/monitor/metric-definitions/list#metricdefinition).

name.description: The invariant value of metric name

ResourceMetricUpdate.description:
Associated metric definition for particular metrics of the azure resource (
Refer :
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/monitor/metric-definitions/list#metricdefinition).

value.description: The value of the secret for the respective type

lastModifiedDateTime.description: The last Modified datetime(RFC 3339 literal format).

passFailCriteria.description: Pass fail criteria for a test.

autoStopCriteria.description: Auto stop criteria for a test. This will automatically stop a load test if the error percentage is high for a certain time window.

secrets.description:
Secrets can be stored in an Azure Key Vault or any other secret store. If the
secret is stored in an Azure Key Vault, the value should be the secret
identifier and the type should be AKV_SECRET_URI. If the secret is stored
elsewhere, the secret value should be provided directly and the type should be
SECRET_VALUE.

environmentVariables.description: Environment variables which are defined as a set of <name,value> pairs.

baselineTestRunId.description: Id of the test run to be marked as baseline to view trends of client-side metrics from recent test runs

inputArtifacts.description: The input artifacts for the test.

testId.description: Unique test identifier for the load test, must contain only lower-case alphabetic, numeric, underscore or hyphen characters.

subnetId.description: Subnet ID on which the load test instances should run.

publicIPDisabled.description: Inject load test engines without deploying public IP for outbound access

keyvaultReferenceIdentityType.description: Type of the managed identity referencing the Key vault.

keyvaultReferenceIdentityId.description: Resource Id of the managed identity referencing the Key vault.

servers.description: These APIs allow end users to create, view and run load tests using Azure Load Test Service.
